meanings.definition: A buffet meal with a variety of hot and cold dishes.
meanings.sent1: At the party, the guests enjoyed the smorgasbords with many different foods to choose from.
meanings.sent2: The hotel offered a delicious smorgasbords for breakfast, including pancakes, eggs, and fruits.
meanings.sent3: The smorgasbords at the event were so tempting that I couldn't decide what to try first!
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was like a smorgasbords of colors, with dresses in every shade of the rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The market displayed a vibrant smorgasbords of fresh produce, enticing shoppers with its variety.

meanings.definition: A wide range or assortment of something.
meanings.sent1: The library had a smorgasbords of books on different topics, catering to all readers.
meanings.sent2: She was amazed by the smorgasbords of flowers in the garden, each one more beautiful than the last.
meanings.sent3: His collection of stamps was a smorgasbords of rare and unique pieces from around the world.
meanings.sent4: The artist's palette held a smorgasbords of colors, ready to create a masterpiece on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased a smorgasbords of artifacts, giving visitors a glimpse into history.
